title: Drawing, "Drawing. Study.  "Bridge over the River Combeima / at Ibaque", Colombia", July 16, 1853
medium: Graphite, brush and white and oxidized gouache on cream-colored paper, discolored to dark brown on verso.
markings:
Recto:  Stamped in ink, at lower left:  Lugt 457c
Verso:  Stamped in ink, at lower center:  Lugt 457d
inscribed:
Recto:  Inscribed in graphite, at lower left:  Bridge over the River Combeima / at Ibaque  =  The name given, was  the name of a celebrated Indian chieftain / who governed part of the country and / distinguished himself by his prowess in / encounters with the Spaniards; and at lower center:  July 16 - 1853

Verso:  Inscribed in graphite, at upper left:  Pincheon / Lispinard 3 doors below Church / Canal to church / Brushes Badger / Theodore Kelly / 16 Arcade / Phil.
description: Horizontal view of the pinnacled bridge in the center of middleground surrounded by trees and bushes with hill and mountages in the background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Drawing. Study.  "Bridge over the River Combeima / at Ibaque", Colombia", July 16, 1853.
July 16, 1853. Graphite, brush and white and oxidized gouache on cream-colored paper, discolored to dark brown on verso.. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-77.
